publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: When first the Squire and Tinker Wood
Gravely consulting Irelands good
Together Mingled in a Mass
Smiths Dust, Copper, lead, and Brass
The Mixture thus by Chimick art
United close in every part
In fillets roul'd, or cut in peices
Appear'd like one continued Species
And by the forming E overIngine struck
On all the same impression stuck.
So to confound this hated Coyne
All partys, and Religeons Joyne.
Whigs, Torys, Trimmers, Hannoverians
Quakers, Conformists, Presbyterians,
Scots, Irish, English, French Unite
With equal Intrest, equal Spight
Together Mingled in a lump
And all in one opinion Jump
And every one begins to find
The same Impression on his mind
A strange event, whom Gold encites
To blood, and Quarrells, Brass unites.
So Goldsmiths say, the coarsest Stuff
Will serve for Saudder well enough.
So by the Kettles loud allarm over one or two characters erased
The Bees are gather'd to a Swarm.
So by the Brazen Trumpets Bluster
Troops of all Tongues, and Nations Muster,
And to the Harp of Ireland Brings

Whole Crouds about its Brazon Strings.There is a Chain let down from JoveBut fastned to his Throne aboveSo strong that from the lower endThey say all Human things depend.This Chain, as ancients poets hold,When Jove was young, was made of gold.
Prometheus this Chain purloyn'd
Dissolv'd, and into Money Coyn'd.
Then whips him on a Chain of Brass
(Venus was brib'd to let it pass)
Now while this Brazon chain prevail'd
Jove saw that all Devotion fail'd
No Temples to his Godship raisd
No Sacrafice on Alters Blaz'd.
In short such dire confusions follow'd
Earth must have been in Chaos swallowd
Jove stood Amaz'd, but looking round
With much ado the Cheat he found
T'was plain he cou'd no longer hold
The World in any Chain but Gold
And to the God of wealth his Brother
Sent Mercury to get another
Prometheus on a Rock is laid
Tyed with the chain himself had made
On icy Caucasus to shiver
While Vultures eat his Growing Liver.
Ye powers of Grubstreet make me able
Discreetly to apply this fable!
Say, who is to be understood
By that old thief Prometheus? Wood.
For Jove it is not hard to Guess him
I mean his M────y God bless him.
This thief and blacksmith was so bold
he strove to steal that Chain of Gold
Which links the Subjects to the King
And change it for a Brazon String
But sure if nothing else must pass
Between the King and us but Brass
Altho the chain shoud never crack
Yet our Devotion may grow slack.
But Jove will soon convert I hope
The Brazon Chain into a Rope
With which Prometheus shall be Tyed
And high in air forever ride
Where if we find his liver grows
for want of Vultures we have Crows.344-232O
